segments.key_quote: The only request is don't spoil it
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada's repeated requests to maintain the established principles and avoid spoiling the movement.
segments.transcript: that the movement should not flounder in his absence. On April 10, 1977, Srila Prabhupada said, "Don't spoil it. We are very good, prestigious people. Don't spoil it. It's a hard day. It started with a very emotional moment. I am in humble condition, I am just comfortable, such exalted position. Don't spoil it. That is my request. Increase. That will depend on your character, behavior, position." Srila Prabhupada repeated the same request on April 22, 1977, saying, "Keep to our principle and see our GVP. It's very a lot. Then everything is gone. I am not there. Do that. That is my request. Whatever I left to you, I have taught you. Follow that. Nobody will be able to do it. No māyā will tell you. Now Kṛṣṇa is giving us, and there is no scarcity of money. To cut both, I'm sorry. Everything is there. You have got good sages all over the world. You have got, in the street you have got… Even if I die suddenly, you'll be able to manage. That I want. Manage nicely, don't go back." That was Prabhupada's concern. Again, Srila Prabhupada reiterated the same concern on 29th April 1977, where he said, "The only request is, don't spoil it."

segments.key_quote: Sheila Prabhupada wanted that whatever he had set up should continue without changes and then the movement would flourish unhindered
segments.summary: Explanation of the three primary things Srila Prabhupada established: deity worship, disciplic succession, and pure books.
segments.transcript: Srila Prabhupada wanted that whatever he had set up should continue without changes, and then the movement would flourish unhindered. Out of the many things that Srila Prabhupada set up in ISKCON, three things were primary. One was the system of deity worship. Everything that was offered to the deities, whether the arathis or the bhoga, would have to be first offered to the guru, Srila Prabhupada, and then to Nithyananda Prabhu. After that, then the arathi or the bhoga would be offered to Goranga Maha Prabhu, then it would be offered to Radharani, and finally it would get offered to Krishna. This was the system of deity worship Srila Prabhupada set up. The second thing was the disciplic conclusion, which was all the deities were offered to the guru and then there in Prabhupada's books in their pure and unadulterated form.

segments.key_quote: Basis on the order of Krishna. Originally, the order is from Krishna.
segments.summary: An exchange between Srila Prabhupada and Mr. Kevin Lehart about how Srila Prabhupada chooses leaders based on the order of Krishna through disciplic succession.
segments.transcript: and discrimination. Now, interestingly, there is an exchange between Srila Prabhupada and one Mr. Kevin Lehart, which was recorded on 14th of July 1976. Listen to this carefully as Srila Prabhupada explains how he appointed temple presidents, how he appointed devotees to BBT positions, etc. "How do you choose? You are responsible for the organization." "Yes." "Are you the one who chooses, who runs each center, who is responsible in each temple?" "Yes. Our program is to open centers in every village, every town to Prabhupada and Krishnapada." "And you choose the leaders?" "Yes." "What Krishna does, he tells you, how does that work?" "No. I have been chosen by my spiritual master." "And you in turn choose others?" "Yes. That is our succession." "On what basis?" "Basis on the order of Krishna. Originally, the order is from Krishna." "How does that come?" "It comes by disciplic succession. Just like Krishna, Krishna said this knowledge to Arjuna, and Arjuna said to others, and it is open. Everyone can take it. There is no secrecy. We have to accept order. That's all."

segments.key_quote: God speaks to you when you are qualified. You cannot expect God as order supplier.
segments.summary: Discussion on the qualifications for leadership and whether it involves direct communication from Krishna.
segments.transcript: "I missed that. I am sorry. The order is already there. It is open, open secret. There is no secrecy. Anyone can take it. All right. But in terms of specific, say, choosing specific things, specific details." "Yes. In all details. How to become Krishna Karsayas, there is all details in this book. Bhagavad Gita as it is." So he is asking what is a man's qualification to be chosen? In other words, Prabhupada will decide who should be leader if he is qualified. And there is a process for making him qualified. And there is a process for testing to see if he is qualified. So in that way, it all comes from Krishna. "You chose, for example, these fellows here to run the publishing house and be responsible for..." "Yes. Like he is in charge of publication. He is in charge of doing his research." "On what basis, sir? Can you tell me some of the things?" "Basis, just to see whether he is qualified. That's all. Just like ordinarily, when manager is appointed, by the superior authority, on the merit, on his qualification, that's all." "Okay. It's not... It's a mediated choice, or is it a direct communication from Krishna? That's my question." "No." Oh, he is asking whether we claim that God speaks to us directly. "Yes. God speaks to you when you are qualified. You cannot expect God as order supplier. Yes. When He speaks to you, you are qualified. You cannot expect God as order supplier."

segments.key_quote: A devotee always concerns Kṛṣṇa, and he gives order.
segments.summary: Discussion on how Krishna communicates and how a devotee always concerns Krishna in their decisions.
segments.transcript: I give them the understanding by which they can come to me. God is situated in everyone's… As soon as he sees that here is a qualified person, then he gives him instruction. But in the same way that Kṛṣṇa says he will provide for all your needs, you still must work to achieve whatever Kṛṣṇa is giving you. You work for Kṛṣṇa. You have to work to get your necessities. In the same way, I am curious with respect to the way Kṛṣṇa communicates with you, whether it's in a similar kind of way that gives you your necessities. In other words, when you decide that someone is to be in charge of a particular temple, does Kṛṣṇa tell you that this person should be in charge? You, by judging him, say this person is qualified." "Yes. Because a devotee always concerns Kṛṣṇa, and he gives order. So that's a more direct communication." "Yes. And he gives order. Because intelligence… Our philosophy is that intelligence comes from Kṛṣṇa. So if I have something… Your philosophy is that your daily necessities come from Kṛṣṇa." "Yes. I understand. Suppose my intelligence sees that this person is qualified, that means Kṛṣṇa has told me." "No, not necessarily. Kṛṣṇa will tell directly. A devotee always concerns Kṛṣṇa, and Kṛṣṇa tells him. Two levels. Not figuratively. Practically. Does that apply then to other kinds of decisions and other kinds of activities as well?" "Everything. Everything. Because a devotee… A devotee does not do anything without concerning Kṛṣṇa."

segments.key_quote: Therefore the minor devotees, they concern the spiritual master. That is our process.

segments.key_quote: Kṛṣṇa will tell directly. A devotee always consults Kṛṣṇa and Kṛṣṇa tells him, do like this, not figuratively, practically.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada always consulted Krishna directly for appointing leaders, and Krishna would give direct orders.
segments.transcript: Now, in this exchange, Śrīla Prabhupāda, on being questioned by Mr. Kevin Lehart, about how he appointed temple presidents and devotees to BBT positions, Rāmēśvara Prabhu interpreted Śrīla Prabhupāda's answer by saying, "Suppose my intelligence sees that this person is qualified, that means Kṛṣṇa has told me." This was Rāmēśvara Prabhu's interpretation. In effect, Rāmēśvara Prabhu said that the decision was made by using one's intelligence and that meant that Kṛṣṇa had ordered it. In other words, he said that there is no direct consultation with Kṛṣṇa. But Śrīla Prabhupāda immediately corrected him saying, "No, not necessarily." He said that Kṛṣṇa will tell directly. A devotee always consults Kṛṣṇa and Kṛṣṇa tells him, do like this, not figuratively, practically.
